  4. PK/FK icons, color-coded fields, and cardinality indicators
  5. Fully adjustable connectors and movable tables

plugins.name: Frame 427320547 Cleaner
plugins.description:
Frame 427320547 Cleaner is a smart Figma plugin designed to streamline designers' workflows. It automatically renames layers in your design files, assigning appropriate names based on layer types and properties. Key features include:

  1. Automatic identification and renaming of various layer types, such as frames, components, instances, etc.
  2. Customizable renaming options, including whether to include locked layers, hidden layers, etc.
  3. Choice between PascalCase and kebab-case naming styles
  4. Option to display spacing information in auto-layout frame names
  5. Batch processing of selected layers and their children


---


Source code: Github

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
‚ùó Currently in BETA - let me know in comments below if you find bugs!


Instantly switch to a different theme by swaping variables and styles in your screens/components.


How it works:


1. Create your styles and variables having a theme name as a top folder name, e.g.:

ThemeA/color/bg/primary
ThemeB/color/bg/primary
ThemeC/color/bg/primary

ThemeA/radius/card
ThemeB/radius/card
ThemeC/radius/card


2. Use your theme variables and styles in components and screens.

3. Select any element (component, frame, or text)

4. Pick themes to swap from and to (e.g. "ThemeB" ‚Üí "ThemeC")

5. Swap all variables and styles within a selection with just one click!


Save time and effort in your design process by quickly adapting your screens to various themes.


Unlike Figma Modes, this gives you unlimited amount of Themes you can create and use!


---


‚ö†Ô∏è Themes are derived only from all top-level variable and style folder names.


Supported Figma Variables:

  1. Fill color
  2. Stroke color
  3. Stroke width
  4. Gradient stop color
  5. Corner radius
  6. Shadow color
  7. Size
  8. Gap, Padding
  9. Opacity
  10. Show/Hide


Supported Figma Styles:

  1. Color
  2. Text
  3. Effect


Will be adding more, let me know if something is not working as expected!


Enjoy! üòé

plugins.name: QuickText
plugins.description:
Take control of your text with this all-in-one plugin! ü•Å


üìñ Changelog v6.0

  1. Added Text Style Preservation: Keep font styles, weights, and sizes intact during transformations.
  2. Added Color Fill Preservation: Highlighted words retain their specific color fills after formatting.



Apply common text formats instantly:

  1. Title Case: Capitalize each word (excluding conjunctions & acronyms) for a polished look.
  2. Sentence Case: Start sentences with a capital while keeping acronyms intact.
  3. Uppercase/Lowercase: Convert text to all caps or lowercase for emphasis or consistency.
  4. Line Break Control: Add or remove line breaks for precise paragraph formatting.
  5. Extra Space Remover: Eliminate unwanted spaces, ensuring clean and readable text.



‚ú® Why Use This Plugin?

  1. Save Time & Effort: Say goodbye to manual text formatting‚Äîlet the plugin handle it in seconds!
  2. Consistent Results: Ensure your designs always look professional and cohesive.
  3. Style & Highlight Retention: Maintain your original text styles and highlights, even after applying formatting.



üìß Feedback & Support

We value your feedback! For any bugs, suggestions, or help using the plugin, feel free to reach out to us at ujaydip9@gmail.com.

plugins.name: Print on Demand Automator

Are you tired of spending hours on repetitive tasks to create print-on-demand designs? This Figma plugin can help you save valuable time. plugins.name: Bannners
plugins.description:
Banner Generator

Easily create custom banners in any size and shape for your creative campaigns.


Setup Requirements

For optimal performance, please follow these guidelines:

Layer Names (Important):

  1. Logo
  2. Heading
  3. Subtext
  4. CTA (Call-to-Action)
  5. Product
  6. Pattern
  7. Background

Component Structure (Important):

  1. Images and groups should be components (e.g., Logo, Product, Background, Patterns)
  2. Heading and Subtext can be free-standing text layers
  3. CTA works best as an Auto Layout


Key Features

  1. Generate banners in both portrait and landscape orientations
  2. Align elements to suit your design needs
  3. Resize banners effortlessly


Check the demo file for reference: https://www.figma.com/design/vpgRYtBzv5iQQE1wsDCPUV/Crafttor-Banner?node-id=0-1&t=AVGyvfVGR0Dta6vJ-1


We're Just Getting Started!

Your feedback is crucial in shaping the future of this plugin. Help us improve by sharing your thoughts at info@crafttor.om. Stay tuned for updates and new features!

Download and start creating stunning banners today!

plugins.name: SVG2Fontify
plugins.description:
Figma plugin to easily export icons to font and output a TTF/EOT/WOFF/SVG/CSS/TSX


Features

  • Supported Font Formats: WOFF, EOT, TTF, SVG
  • Framework Support: Vue, React, TypeScript
  • CSS Support
  • Customization: Fontname, Prefix, Suffix, Version
  • Additional Tools: Preview site HTML file provided

Usage

  1. Install: Download and install the Figma Plugin SVG2Fontify.
  2. Selection: Select icons that you wish to export.
  3. Activation: Access the plugin via the plugins section and run it.
  4. Configuration: (Optional) Configure settings like Fontname, Prefix, Suffix, Version.
  5. Framework Specifics: (Optional) Specify framework integration settings for React or Vue.
  6. Generate: Click on Generate to create your custom fonts.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Convert SVGs to Icon Fonts in Figma!

plugins.name: VariableScout
plugins.description:
VariableScout


The Essential Power Tool for Streamlined Variable Management. Effortlessly visualize, organize, and optimize your variables and nodes with various features designed to supercharge your workflow.


Core Features


  1. Variable Tracking: Comprehensive overview of all variables and their connections to nodes in your documents page
  2. Smart Filtering: Filter variables by type (Color, Number, Text, Boolean) and nodes by category (Components, Instances, Frames, Text, Shapes)
  3. Search System: Lightweight search functionality to quickly find specific variables, nodes, or collections
  4. Node Selection: Select individual nodes, multiple nodes, or entire path segments directly from the plugin to canvas
  5. Real-time Selection: Automatically updates to show variables connected to your selected nodes on canvas
  6. View Options: Only Unused Variables: Focus on variables not currently used in your document, Only Selected Nodes: Show variables only for nodes selected on canvas, Merge Collections: Combine all variables into a single, streamlined view, Hide Hidden Layers: Filter out variables connected to hidden layers, Focused View: Simplified display of variable values and node paths
  7. Customizable Export: Export your filtered and searched variables in JSON or CSV format - what you see is what you export
  8. Variable Swapping: Easily swap variables across multiple selected nodes simultaneously
  9. Collection Management: View and organize variables from both local and library collections


Key Benefits


  1. Time-Saving: Quick access to variable information and instant navigation to connected nodes on canvas
  2. Better Organization: Clear overview of variable usage and easy identification of unused variables
  3. Enhanced Workflow: Streamline variable management with automatic selection sync and multiple view options
  4. Project Clarity: Identify unused variables quickly, Focus on specific node selections, Clean up your document by finding hidden layer variables, Get a clear overview with merged or separated collections
  5. Team Efficiency: Share and manage variables across team libraries with intuitive collection organization
  6. Customizable Experience: Multiple view options to match your specific workflow needs
  7. Flexible Export: Export exactly what you need by applying filters, search, and view options before exporting
  8. Canvas Integration: Seamlessly navigate between plugin and canvas with bidirectional node selection


‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî


Please note:


The plugin is currently in Open Beta, which means it‚Äôs open to everyone to try for free during this testing period. This is an opportunity to explore all features, including VariableScout Pro functionalities, at no cost for a limited time.


As this is a beta version, some features might still be refined, and feedback is invaluable in helping improve it before the final release. Thank you for being part of this journey!


Loading collections and mapping variables to nodes for the first time may take longer than subsequent loads. Future loading times will be faster. Loading large collections (>2500 variables and/or 25000 Nodes) may take some time.
plugins.tagline: Visualize, organize, and optimize variables and nodes with features designed to boost your workflow.

plugins.name: MP Asset Generator
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to update the styles and logos of Marriage Pact assets to reuse your design for other colleges. Aside from creating two components and changing paint styles, this plugin will not mutate your Figma file in any way.


Colors

Your file should already have color styles with a hierarchy relatively like "[Print/Digital/Text] > [Primary/Secondary]". If not, clicking any colored square should initialize them with the appropriate brand colors.


Logo

When clicking "Update Logo", the plugin looks for the group "Logos/Editable Digital Logo" on the first page and creates (or updates) the components "Digital Logo" and "Print Logo", which are scalable copies of whatever lies in Editable Digital Logo.


If your file doesn't have any such component, "Update Logo" will display an error in the plugin, and no action will be taken.


---

If you have any questions, feel free to contact jerryh2@stanford.edu.

plugins.name: Tracking Plan Companion
plugins.description:
Hand over and instrument your analytics tracking plan 10x times faster with 90% fewer bugs, while creating visual documentation of all your product analytics events.


üë©‚ÄçüöÄ How does it work?

1. Start the plugin to see an overview of all tracking events present in your Figma design file.

2. Select an event to zoom into the element it belongs to

3. Copy the pseudocode or download the JSON and modify as needed


Note that you can also select a single screen frame to only see the events present in that given screen.

plugins.name: Vectorizer - Auto Trace Batch Images
plugins.description:
Easily convert selected bitmap layers (such as PNG/JPG images) into scalable black-and-white vectors with a single click. This plugin sends your selected images to a secure cloud-based vectorization service and automatically places the resulting SVG next to the original image, preserving layout and alignment.


Key Features:


‚úÖ One-click conversion of Bitmap-based into vector

‚úÖ Places the vector result neatly to the right of the original image

‚úÖ Supports batch processing of multiple images at once

‚úÖ Lightweight UI and seamless integration with Figma workflow


This plugin is ideal for designers who need to vectorize hand-drawn sketches, scanned artwork, or raster logos without leaving Figma.

plugins.name: Points
plugins.description:
Points: Organize your keynotes, bookmarks and todos.


Bring clarity and order to your Figma presentations. The Points Plugin is your tool for effortlessly organizing keynotes, managing bookmarks, and staying on top of to-dos‚Äîall within a sleek, intuitive interface designed to make your workflow smooth and efficient.


Effortless Control, Intuitive Experience.


With just a few clicks, Points lets you rename, reorder, and color-code key project items and points, giving you a clear view of each task‚Äôs status at a glance. Need to update or remove a point? It‚Äôs quick and seamless, keeping your project details relevant and up-to-date, so your presentations are always sharp.


Perfect for Every Presentation Moment.


Whether it‚Äôs a design review, client presentation, or team collaboration, Points brings simplicity and structure to your Figma experience. Make every keynote, bookmark, and to-do count‚Äîbecause organized ideas make the best presentations.


-


* Help


The Project List allows drag to reordering, renaming, and deletion.


In the Point List, right-click or double-click to edit titles, drag to reorder, and use color markers to mark status. update links points to new nodes or views, or remove it.

plugins.name: Bluebrint Plugin
plugins.description:
Sync your design with Blueprint


Steps:

  1. Select a frame. The frame is going to be synchronized.
  2. Click "EXPORT" button. It will opens Blueprint in Web browser.
  3. Select a Blueprint project.
  4. Accept the consent screen. Blueprint requires READ permissions of the Figma file.
  5. You are ready to refer the frame from Blueprint!

plugins.name: Lucidi - Sync Opacity Styles
plugins.description:
Figma doesn't support maintaining layer style while changing opacity, so designers have to keep and update color styles for multiple opacities. Doing this manually can become a nightmare, so I made a plugin to automatically create, sync and update these styles.


Features


Quickly create opacity styles based of current solid color styles

  1. Enter a list of opacities you need in your color library;
  2. Write a pattern for style name (e.g. $N-alpha$A will turn into primary-alpha50 );
  3. Press "Create & sync styles".


Sync your existing colors when solid solid opaque colors change

Don't manually update values of opacity colors styles, just change your main color style and start the plugin.


Clean up unused opacity styles

Optionally rewrite and delete opacity styles that don't match your parameters.


This is a first beta launch of this plugin, feel free to reach for support anytime ‚ú®

accepted.name: Dmytro Kondakov
accepted.description: Designing software, writing code, crafting things

plugins.tagline: Generate and sync opacity styles with local library colors

plugins.name: Fig Tool
plugins.description:
Fig Tool ‚Äì All-in-One Figma Design Assistant with Flip UI to RTL feature: https://sites.google.com/view/fig-tool/home

A comprehensive plugin to speed up your Figma workflow with smart selection, editing, color control, and RTL support. With LANGUAGE TRANSLATION


Overview

Fig Tool is built to supercharge your design process with a collection of powerful utilities, all within a responsive and intuitive interface. Whether you're managing components, flipping layouts for RTL languages, or batch-editing styles, Fig Tool adapts to your workflow with horizontal and vertical layout modes.


üîë Key Features

Smart Selection

All Text: Select every text layer in a frame


By Alignment: Filter text layers by left, center, or right alignment


All Components: Select all component instances, including nested ones


First Layer Components: Focus on top-level component instances


Flip In Place: Horizontally flip elements without moving them


Reverse Align: Switch text alignment direction


Component Breaking

Detach Components: Break components for editing flexibility


Options: Selected only, All, First Layer


Ungroup Objects: Break apart group structures


Unframe Elements: Flatten frames for direct editing


Color Control

Adjust hue, saturation, and lightness (HSB sliders)


Target fills, strokes, effects, or all at once


Apply changes to multiple elements with one click


Lorem Ipsum Generator

Insert placeholder text with start customization


Add/remove word count


Smart fill to match text box dimensions


Copy/Paste Styles

Copy from a source element


Paste to multiple targets


Choose specific properties:


Effects, Fills, Strokes


Corners, Layout, Opacity, Blend Modes


Prefix/Suffix Name Manager

Add or remove prefixes and suffixes in bulk


Clean up layer naming for consistent organization


üåê Flip UI ‚Äì RTL Support

Convert left-to-right (LTR) layouts to right-to-left (RTL) for languages like Arabic or Hebrew:


Detaches all components for accurate mirroring


Flips layout horizontally


Adjusts text alignment (left ‚Üî right)


Handles images and containers intelligently


‚ö†Ô∏è Important: This feature detaches components. Use a duplicate frame to preserve your original design.


üì¶ Fig Box ‚Äì Visual Element Library

A personal design library for frequently used elements:


Add to Fig Box: Save selected elements


Insert or Replace: Drop items into current designs or replace existing ones


Search & Organize: Quickly find stored elements


Stored locally ‚Äì private to your device and persistent across sessions


üñ•Ô∏è Dual Interface Modes

Choose a layout that fits your screen and workflow:


Horizontal Mode: Toolbar across the top for quick access


Vertical Mode: Compact sidebar for focused editing

Switch easily using the ‚áÑ layout switcher. Expand or shrink the panel using the ‚áî toggle.


üí° Tips for Efficient Use

Use selection filters before applying edits for better precision


Flip designs for RTL only on duplicated frames


Organize Fig Box items with meaningful names for faster reuse


Combine name management with selection tools to apply naming systems quickly


‚ùì Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

Q: Do both layout modes offer the same features?

Yes, both modes offer full access. Choose based on your screen size or personal preference.


Q: Will detaching components affect my master library?

No, it only affects instances in your selection. Original components remain untouched.


Q: Can I apply color changes to multiple items at once?

Absolutely. Just select all relevant elements and apply your HSB edits.


Q: Does Fig Box store my elements online?

No, all Fig Box items are stored locally in your browser, keeping your designs private and fast.


Q: How does the plugin generate Lorem Ipsum text?

It calculates based on your text box's size and font properties to fit naturally within the design.


üîî What‚Äôs New in This Major Release

üöÄ Fig Tool 2.0 ‚Äì More than just RTL!


Previously known as "Flip UI ‚Äì Make It RTL", the plugin now includes 20+ features to boost productivity


Renamed to "Fig Tool" to reflect its wider utility beyond RTL support


Smart selection, color manipulation, Fig Box, and batch operations added


üìû Contact & Support

For questions, feature suggestions, or bug reports, reach out via the Figma Community.


Fig Tool ‚Äî Design faster, smarter, and with more control.

All the tools you need. In one place.
plugins.tagline: Fig Tool - All-in-One Figma Design Assistant with One Click Flip UI - RTL Feature

plugins.name: Text Contrast Checker (APCA WCAG3)
plugins.description:
APCA Contrast Checker evaluates text accessibility using the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) for WCAG 3. Unlike traditional WCAG 2 tools, it provides more perceptually accurate assessments by considering font size, weight, and purpose to ensure truly readable designs.


APCA Contrast Checker for WCAG 3

The APCA Contrast Checker plugin brings the next generation of accessibility standards to Figma, implementing the Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) developed for WCAG 3 (formerly known as "Silver").


Why APCA Instead of WCAG 2?

Traditional contrast ratios used in WCAG 2 have significant limitations - they treat all color pairs equally regardless of their perceptual differences, often allowing unreadable dark color combinations to "pass" while flagging perfectly readable light combinations as "failures."


APCA solves these problems by:

  1. Accounting for human perception of contrast based on modern vision research
  2. Considering text properties (size, weight, purpose) when determining readability
  3. Providing appropriate contrast levels for different reading scenarios
  4. Delivering more accurate evaluations for both light and dark modes


Key Features

  1. Text Property Analysis: Automatically detects and evaluates font size, weight, and color
  2. Context-Aware Evaluation: Adjusts contrast requirements based on text purpose (body text, headings, UI labels, or non-text elements)
  3. Conformance Levels: Indicates both Bronze (general) and Silver (detailed) level compliance
  4. WCAG 2 Compatibility: Shows approximate WCAG 2 ratio equivalents for reference
  5. Visual Contrast Meter: Displays contrast levels with an intuitive visual indicator
  6. Detailed Recommendations: Provides specific guidance to improve readability
  7. Interactive Controls: Adjust text properties and see results in real-time
  8. Font Size Guidance: Includes minimum font size recommendations based on contrast level and weight


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer in your Figma design
  2. The plugin will automatically evaluate the contrast between the text and its background
  3. Adjust font size, weight, or purpose using the controls to see how they affect compliance
  4. Use the recommendations to improve accessibility
  5. Swap text and background colors with one click to test inverse color schemes


About APCA and Conformance Levels

APCA provides two conformance levels:

  1. Bronze Level: General guidelines suitable for basic contrast evaluation without reference to lookup tables.
  2. Silver Level: More detailed requirements using font size and weight lookup tables for greater accuracy and flexibility.


This plugin implements the full APCA algorithm (Beta 0.1.9 G-4g) and follows the official lookup tables published by Myndex Research, the developers of APCA.


Upgrade your accessibility workflow with perceptually accurate contrast checking that goes beyond simple ratios to ensure your designs are truly readable for all users.
plugins.tagline: Text accessibility, scientifically measured! WCAG3

plugins.description:
You no longer need to manually update at least 7x5=35 date instances!

Update your calendar to the desired month, year, and selected date easily.


Features:

  1. Instantly update all dates without manually editing each one.
  2. Automatically reflect each styles such as "today" and "selected date."
  3. Fully supports calendars that include ISO Week.


Calendar instances must meet the following conditions:

  1. Each date element must be an same Instance where Properties can be configured.
  2. Dates belonging to the same week must be grouped into a single row.

plugins.name: Text Repeat Grid
plugins.description:
Introducing the "Text Repeat Grid" Plugin for Figma


This plug-in was primarily created to make working with tables and repeating elements / grid layouts with text a lot easier and faster. However you can use it for many other things as well, like e.g. copying text from a group to a component (using the ‚ÄúGet Text From Selection‚Äù feature) and pasting it to a component or vice versa, create variations by randomizing table column data etc.


In conjunction with Figma core features, it provides a replacement for the amazing Adobe XD ‚ÄúRepeat Grid‚Äù feature.


Hopefully this plug-in will revolutionize the way you manage text in your designs. Here's how it can help you streamline your workflow:


Manual Input & Text File Upload

- Whether you're typing directly into the text input field or uploading a text file, this feature allows you to populate selected text frames quickly. Simply enter your text or upload a file, and each line of text will be automatically distributed to your selected text frames in the order they appear in the layers panel.

* Create realistic layouts by using text that makes sense

* Use your favourite software or AI chat bot to create content

* Each line will be filled in a separate text layer of your current selection

* e.g. user names, dates, locations, headlines, labels, tags etc.


Spreadsheet Input

Need to fill a table like-structure? The spreadsheet feature lets you drag and drop a spreadsheet file to fill text frames across multiple columns and rows simultaneously. Just remember, your text frames need to be organized in a table-like structure in Figma ‚Äì think of nesting your text cells in rows or columns. Make sure you select all related columns or rows before applying the text.

You can select between a column-first and a row-first structure to fill the data according to your layer architecture.


This feature shines in scenarios like setting up a multi-field form or a dashboard where data is organized in grids. It ensures that each piece of data lands exactly where it's supposed to, across both rows and columns, saving you the hassle of manual entry.


Randomize Input

With a simple toggle, you can randomize the order of your text inputs. This is particularly useful when you want to experiment with different orders, create variations, or make the same data not look repetitive, without rearranging text manually.


Get Text from Selection

If you need to repurpose or edit text already placed in your designs, this feature makes it a breeze. Just select the text frames you want to edit, and the plugin will pull the text from each frame, allowing you to quickly make changes or redistribute the text.

* Use as copy & paste from many to many text layers

* Translation: Quickly copy text, translate in your favourite tool and paste it back


Why You'll Love It: "Text Repeat Grid" not only enhances your productivity but also integrates seamlessly into your design process, allowing you more time to focus on creativity and less on repetitive tasks.


So, ready to speed up your design process? Give "Text Repeat Grid" a try and watch your efficiency soar!
plugins.tagline: Fill any number of text layers from input, txt file or spreadsheet. Lightning fast tables, grids ...

plugins.name: OK Palette
plugins.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette‚Äôs path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.

plugins.tagline: Generates tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space

117461.name: OK Palette
117461.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette‚Äôs path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.
